original_sentence: WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Doctors removed five small polyps from President Bush's colon on Saturday, and "none appeared worrisome," a White House spokesman said.
cleaned_sentence: washington cnn doctor removed five small polyp president bush colon saturday none appeared worrisome white house spokesman said

original_sentence: The polyps were removed and sent to the National Naval Medical Center in Bethesda, Maryland, for routine microscopic examination, spokesman Scott Stanzel said.
cleaned_sentence: polyp removed sent national naval medical center bethesda maryland routine microscopic examination spokesman scott stanzel said

original_sentence: Results are expected in two to three days.

original_sentence: All were small, less than a centimeter [half an inch] in diameter, he said.

original_sentence: Bush is in good humor, Stanzel said, and will resume his activities at Camp David.
cleaned_sentence: bush good humor stanzel said resume activity camp david

original_sentence: During the procedure Vice President Dick Cheney assumed presidential power.

original_sentence: Bush reclaimed presidential power at 9:21 a.m. after about two hours.

original_sentence: Doctors used "monitored anesthesia care," Stanzel said, so the president was asleep, but not as deeply unconscious as with a true general anesthetic.

original_sentence: He spoke to first lady Laura Bush -- who is in Midland, Texas, celebrating her mother's birthday -- before and after the procedure, Stanzel said.

original_sentence: Afterward, the president played with his Scottish terriers, Barney and Miss Beazley, Stanzel said.

original_sentence: He planned to have lunch at Camp David and have briefings with National Security Adviser Stephen Hadley and White House Chief of Staff Josh Bolten, and planned to take a bicycle ride Saturday afternoon.

original_sentence: Cheney, meanwhile, spent the morning at his home on Maryland's eastern shore, reading and playing with his dogs, Stanzel said.

original_sentence: Nothing occurred that required him to take official action as president before Bush reclaimed presidential power.

original_sentence: The procedure was supervised by Dr. Richard Tubb, Bush's physician, and conducted by a multidisciplinary team from the National Naval Medical Center in Bethesda, Maryland, the White House said.

original_sentence: Bush's last colonoscopy was in June 2002, and no abnormalities were found, White House spokesman Tony Snow said.

original_sentence: The president's doctor had recommended a repeat procedure in about five years.

original_sentence: A colonoscopy is the most sensitive test for colon cancer, rectal cancer and polyps, small clumps of cells that can become cancerous, according to the Mayo Clinic.

original_sentence: Small polyps may be removed during the procedure.

original_sentence: Snow said on Friday that Bush had polyps removed during colonoscopies before becoming president.

original_sentence: Snow himself is undergoing chemotherapy for cancer that began in his colon and spread to his liver.
